Dialogue.Page: TRAPPIST-1h is the last planet around the star TRAPPIST-1.
TRAPPIST-1h is a small, icy planet just 30% of Earth's mass orbiting far from TRAPPIST-1.
But due to how compact the system is, that's still only 6% Earth's distance from the sun.
It is tidally locked to TRAPPIST-1, with one side always bright and the other always dark.
It is very dim and cold, receiving just around 15% of the light level Earth does, and its surface is over a hundred below freezing.
It probably has no atmosphere, and it is likely covered in a significant amount of ice, more than all of Earth's oceans combined.
Tidal heating from the nearby planets may be able to melt the ice deep under the planets surface, creating subsurface oceans.
It may also be able to force water to the surface in the form of geysers, like Saturn's moon Enceladus.
